attributes.action: Tell us what level of patient care is planned in the NHS for June 2018
attributes.background:
Following the small increased funding for the NHS in the November 2017 budget what will be the following measures of the care it plans compared to this year:
•	expected waiting times 
•	areas and the quantification of care rationing that will take place 
•	estimated numbers of bed-blockers
attributes.additional_details: The information that is available concerning problems in the NHS is sufficient to cause worry that health and social care will deteriorate. We need to understand what level of care is planned by the Government so that we can make a case for a revision in the funding if necessary.

attributes.action: Make broadcasters have content warnings and signpost support for mental illness
attributes.background: While some depictions of people's battles with mental illness in the media can oftentimes be accurate representations and this should be applauded it should also be done safely taking potential risks to the viewer/listener into account by offering warnings before the programme and signposting after.
attributes.additional_details:
Great strides have been made by some TV broadcasters to raise awareness of mental illness by depicting it so accurately, and some broadcasters exemplify how such a sensitive topic should be handled.

However I have noticed how web-based broadcasters offer no warnings of content and offer no signposting after the programme. 

This is potentially dangerous and I feel strongly that people who are vulnerable should be able to enjoy these programmes but know where to find help if needed afterwards.

attributes.action: Scrap VAT on Digital Books
attributes.background: Currently, Print books are exempt from VAT, whereas eBooks are subject to tax.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Government launched an action plan to inspire thousands more pupils to read in 2015, and that digital books are now the preferred medium for many, it makes no sense to tax youngsters whilst trying to increase readership.

If the Government are serious about tackling reading standards, scrapping the VAT on eBooks is surely one way to make a positive impact.

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-action-plan-to-inspire-thousands-more-pupils-to-read

attributes.action: Ensure that no claimant on benefits is left without financial support.
attributes.background: I am hearing about families losing their homes and needing to use food banks due to a sudden removal from one set of benefits to the new one:- universal credit. It can't be right - the benefits should run seamlessly into each other. This is totally inhumane.
attributes.additional_details: This has happened to someon I know with a disabled child.

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016
attributes.background:
This act made the sale, distribution, and consumption of all psychoactive substances (with the exceptions of food, tobacco, alcohol, caffeine and poppers) illegal.
This a ridiculous piece of legislation that in no way serves public health or even law and order, and is in effect a ban on fun.
attributes.additional_details:
This legislation puts people at risk by sending these substances into the hands of criminal gangs. It also criminalises harmless drug users, putting them into contact with more dangerous offenders in prison, and increasing the already dangerously high prison population.
An evidence-based drugs policy will allow for properly safe, regulated use, and allow people who might have problems with these drugs to feel safe getting help. This law is a waste of police resources and an affront to freedom.

attributes.action: Teach domestic abuse to all children in schools
attributes.background: As a single mother of 4 daughters, I have gone through domestic abuse and I am trying to bring my daughters up to know this is wrong, and as they spend a lot of time at school I think all children, girls and boys, would benefit from this being taught at school.
attributes.additional_details:
With domestic abuse on the rise we need to educate our children that this is wrong and not to put up with it. This is the only way to stop this moving on to the next generation. 

We also need to start making parents responsible for the actions of their abusive children. We are fined if our child misses too much school

attributes.action: Stop cyclists from using mobile phones and headphones whilst in motion.
attributes.background: As a cyclist myself, it irritates me when I see other bike riders giving the rest of us a bad reputation by using mobile phones or listening to music on headphones whilst in motion. And don't get me started on ignoring traffic lights! The rules of the road need to be enforced.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for alcoholic drinks to list all ingredients.
attributes.background:
I have a severe life threatening allergy to the artificial colourant E110 (Sunset Yellow) and nuts.

Alcoholic drinks in the UK do NOT have to list their ingredients anywhere, not on the product nor online. 

This is so unsafe for people who have allergies and could lead to preventable deaths

attributes.action: Companies must be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products
attributes.background: In my case, I have found that it is a common theme to find that "gelatine" is an ingredient to many confectionery items. This itself presents a grave concern, as I am a follower of the Islamic faith, who does not eat pork. Thus, failure to specify the type of gelatine is misleading.
attributes.additional_details: The rationale of ingredients being displayed on the back of food packaging is that we are in a position to exercise our autonomy. So, we can make an informed decision of whether or not it is something we wish to consume. This detail should be a basic requirement for all product packaging and be given the attention similar to allergy warnings. This applies to many sectors of society Muslims, Judaism, Hinduism, Sikhism and sects of Christianity. Therefore, essential in such a diverse society.

attributes.action: Create an official medal for emergency services involved in the London attacks.
attributes.background: Reward of a medal in recognition of the phenomenal service provided by London emergency services to all those involved in the summer 2017 London terrorist incidents, including emergency responders as well as investigation teams and counter terrorism officers.
attributes.additional_details: The London summer of 2017, has seen an unprecedented threat from terrorism, with attacks on Westminster Bridge, London Bridge & Borough Market, Finsbury Park, police officers close to Buckingham Palace and a London Underground train. The response of emergency services has been exceptional. This outstanding service to public/country has been publically recognised by the Prime Minster, the Mayor of London, and the Home secretary who rightly quantified that “there has been no summer like it”.

attributes.action: Fund the costs spent by the emergency services following the Manchester attack.
attributes.background: We call on the Government to honour its commitment to fully fund the costs spent by the emergency services and local authorities following the horrific Manchester attack.

attributes.action: Lest we forget! Fly Union Flag all year round to mark centenary of end of WW1
attributes.background:
Next year marks the centenary of the end of the Great War.
As a mark of respect to the fallen who made the ultimate sacrifice so we could be free, we believe that the Union Flag should be flown on all Government buildings for the whole year.
attributes.additional_details:
At the going down of the sun and in the morning we will remember them.
Lest we forget.

attributes.action: Make illegal all cold calling telemarketing calls to UK phone numbers
attributes.background:
Almost all British Citizens have mobile phones near us at all times, and increasingly less control over who has our phone number

Unscrupulous companies call without prior permission, at any time of day or night, in order to sell us unwanted products or services. This behaviour should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details:
Telemarketing has existed in for almost as long as there have been telephones. Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telemarketing

In 2017, 94% of UK adults owned at least one mobile, and there were 26.4m landlines in the UK. Ofcom: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/about-ofcom/latest/media/facts

In 2014, 58% of surveyed companies used telemarketing to generate customer sales. dma.org: https://dma.org.uk/press-release/new-telemarketing-research-reveals-it-s-good-to-talk

In 2013, 85% of householders said they'd received a nuisance call on their landline, 17% complained. thisismoney.co.uk: http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/news/article-2377639/Watchdog-launches-online-tool-reporting-nuisance-calls-texts.html

attributes.action: Waive the two child cap on tax credits for mothers working minimum 18 hours/week
attributes.background: After April 2017, no woman will be able to claim or receive any Tax credits for a third child, unless the child is born as a multiple birth or conceived as a result of a sexual assault. This approach is callous, as well as ignorant, as many women live with men that force them to get pregnant.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government deems third babies a luxury not every family has earned, though the royal’s third baby will be taken care of, courtesy of the TAXPAYER (who's being penalised the same as those who do not work at all).
As long as a woman is in paid work, she should be able to receive tax credit support.
For each child conceived, I believe 6 hours of work is ideal - e.g: 18 hours for 3 children, 24 hours for 4 children, 30 hours for 5 children.
A cap on 5 children (with the exception of one multiple birth of twins) is fair.
If a working mother falls ill or disabled as an unforseeable result, I believe her claim for tax credits should continue. However, a cap should be placed on any children following her illness, unless she is able to return back to work.

attributes.action: Request HM government ask the Queen to issue Royal Pardon to Edith Thompson.
attributes.background: Edith Thompson was drugged and carried unconscious to the gallows in 1923 for a crime I believe she did not commit. My grandfather DI Scholes, acquired the letters she wrote to her lover Freddie Bywaters, which 'proved' her guilt. I do not believe they proved anything. I believe Edith was innocent.
attributes.additional_details: The prosecution sought to prove 'joint enterprise.' I do not believe they did. The jury was wrongly directed by the judge. The letters never incited Freddie to murder. I have read them all. The jury was made up of 11 men and just 1 women. There was no proof that Edith knew her lover, Freddie, would stab her husband that night. An independent witness also testified that she even begged him to stop. This is a terrible miscarriage of justice that has waited 94 years to be rectified.

attributes.action: I would like to see it a legal requirement for cats to be microchipped
attributes.background: It would just make life alot simpler for vets & owners .If something happened to your cat at least you would know instead of forever hoping 😢
attributes.additional_details: I run the group our pets uk and it's very sad the amount of cats that are killed in accidents , if they were microchipped owners would be notified .Cats do stray and would be easier to reunite with owners

attributes.action: End free movement of pets to UK to prevent parasite blinding people and pets.
attributes.background: The pet passport scheme allows EU pets to pass through borders without quarantine allowing the spread of an oriental eye worm that blinds both animals and people. We must quarantine travelling animals and treat them if infected. Infections in humans have been reported throughout mainland Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/oriental-eye-worm-infection-dogs-blindness-spread-uk-thelazia-callipaeda-a7955711.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-4901936/UK-pets-owners-risk-blinding-eye-infection.html

attributes.action: Ban import and export of wild animals and their skins/fur
attributes.background: I love animals, always have and always will, and think it is cruel to kill for their skin when underneath there was a mind and soul even more beautiful that its spotty fur. Also, shipping them away from their natural habitats for someone else's entertainment is horrible.

attributes.action: Advise the Queen to make the London Borough of Richmond a Royal Borough
attributes.background: Richmond has two existing Royal Palaces (Hampton Court & Kew Palace) and a rich history of Royal connections, patronage and places. No borough deserves Royal status more than Richmond.
attributes.additional_details: I wrote to the Secretary of State few years ago asking for Royal Borough status for Richmond and it was politely declined in favour of Greenwich. It's time to ask again via this petition.

attributes.action: To not spend £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust
attributes.background:
Why are we spending £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust? Great Britain didn't carry out this atrocity but spent years fighting at war because of it. 
Surely this is tribute enough? 
Spend our money on more pressing matters at home , e.g.  NHS etc.

attributes.action: Update the driving licence point system from 12 points to at least 15-20
attributes.background: The points system was introduced in 1988 which is nearly 30 years ago. There are so many things you can get points for these days that were not about then. All I'm asking is for the people that are at say one more defective tyre or something away from an automatic ban because of the tot up.
attributes.additional_details: It should still be an instant ban for drink, drug driving. There are more and more ways now to get points than there was when this was introduced.

attributes.action: Make hoax callers to emergency services pay £200 fine or a prison sentence
attributes.background: Over the past year, Wiltshire emergency services had over 1,000 hoax calls, and because they have a duty of care, they have to go to every call, so whilst there attending the hoax calls, there's hundreds of people that need an ambulance
attributes.additional_details: I believe, making sure every hoax call is investigated properly, there there should be a £200 fine or a prison sentence,  and if it's a child doing it, then the parents should pay it, or the child do some kind of community service,

attributes.action: Prevent the tunnel proposals for the A303 under Stonehenge.
attributes.background: Stonehenge is a historic world heritage sight and the proposals to construct a tunnel will seriously damage the local wildlife and the countryside around the famous and ancient historical sight.

attributes.action: Agree to change the law to tag all potential terrorists.
attributes.background: Currently it takes 20 agents to follow 1 terrorist suspect. If there are 300 or 5000 or 20000 people of interest in our communities, our agents have to prioritise who to follow, clearly leaving potential huge risks to the British population of more attacks (5 successful attacks since March).
attributes.additional_details: The ordinary British public have had a enough of wishy washy handling of these attacks being told to carry on as normal. How can we? We need to see some action which provides this nation with security. If you can’t intern them due to political correctness then tag them.

attributes.action:
Mandatory signs on all disabled facilities -
"Not all disabilities are visible"
attributes.background: Since developing a chronic urinary disease, I have found myself needing to use disabled facilities often. However, due to not bearing any obvious or visible disability and only a hidden one, I have faced criticism and been confronted on many occasions as to why I am using such facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and thousands of other people who suffer from unseen disabilities are having to defend ourselves and on many occasions show proof as to why they need to use disabled facilities. 
When I am in need to use the disabled loos, I have often been confronted by others. This is discrimination.

I am petitioning for all disabled facilities in the UK to bear mandatory signs reading "Not all disabilities are visible". 
This is to aim to put a stop to such discrimination and prejudice.

attributes.action: Increase the hourly funding rate for Early Years Education
attributes.background:
Early Years Funding is in Crisis!

National Living Wage is increasing by 4.4% in April.  Employer pension contributions are increasing to 2% at the same time.
Guess how much our funding has gone up by?
0%

Early years providers are closing, please sign and save FREE Early Years Education!
attributes.additional_details:
We have to sign a contract stating it is ILLEGAL for us to get parents to pay top ups to cover the short fall in funding.  Not that they should of course, as the government advertise it as FREE childcare after all!

No other business has what it can charge their customers dictated to them.  The government control what we receive and what we can charge and the result is a deficit for most providers.

Please help is get an increase in funding, in line with the increase of business costs.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of Dagenham Jobcentre
attributes.background:
Dagenham Jobcentre is set to close on 19th January 2018, as part of a program of closures of Jobcentres across the country.
Dagenham residents will struggle to get to Barking Jobcentre.
Residents will risk having payments stopped through sanctions, being forced into debt and destitution.
attributes.additional_details:
Universal credit is too complicated particularly for vulnerable people such as those with mental health issues.
People struggling with the online access risk having their money stopped through sanctions.
Over one million low-paid workers will also be drawn into the new system and could face sanctions if they don’t prove they are applying for better paid work.
Residents in Dagenham NEED a jobcentre in order to be able to cope with the chaos caused by the implementation of Universal Credit.

attributes.action: Make all referendums require 60% of the vote to effect a change
attributes.background: We vote for M.P.s to make decisions on our behalf. They have the time to research and debate issues appropriately. When major decisions are handed over to the population, there is a significant risk of voting being based on  emotional or personal rather than objective reasons.
attributes.additional_details:
There is (as seems to have been the case in the USA and the UK recently) much greater risk of external agencies inappropriately influencing the vote.  And those agencies\individuals who have greater financial resources (and probably lobbying interests) can also unfairly influence the voting patterns.
A 60% majority would to some extent indicate a genuine ground swell of opinion towards the change.

attributes.action: Stop kids under 16 buying all energy drinks
attributes.background: Energy drinks are full of caffeine - no wonder kids have bad attitudes and are hyped all the time. They're pumped up on caffeine.

attributes.action: Limit motorway road works to 1 junction at a time.
attributes.background: With the current influx of “smart” motorways being installed around the country, we have seen neverending roadworks for miles and miles. The current spate of roadworks on the M6 between Jncs 19 and 16 are causing mayhem and misery daily. Accidents occur daily and yet work won’t be done till 2019
attributes.additional_details: I am proposing the government stop Highways England from installing road works for more than one junction at a time. Where the next junction is longer than 5 miles away then the limit be 5 miles. The lanes are too narrow and the lack of a hard shoulder in the inevitable outcome of an incident impedes emergency services and creates hours of tail backs. All to help protect workers which is all well and good if they were actually working on that stretch.

attributes.action: Fit all Heavy or Large Vehicles with Automatic Emergency Braking System (AEBS)
attributes.background: Horrific HGV accidents happen constantly. Automatic emergency braking systems could prevent many deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Humans are subject to fatigue, 'highway hypnosis', sudden medical problems and distractions. Automatic emergency brakes are not subject to any of these problems. According to Campaign For Better Transport: More than half (52%) of fatal accidents on motorways involve HGVs but only 10% of motorway vehicles are HGVs. HGVs are also involved in 1 in 5 fatal crashes on A and minor roads, and its worsening each year. Let's reverse this trend and use technology to prevent more deaths.

attributes.action: To reopen Weston-Super-Mare's A&E between 10pm and 8am
attributes.background: W-S-M, A&E shut on July 4th 2017 due to the fragility of the emergency services due of the lack of senior doctors. At least 27 people use the emergency services each night; from those, 12 are transported by ambulance. Not having their local A&E at their disposal is endangering their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
One resident of Weston Super Mare stated,"We need our local A&E back. The delays encountered by ambulances having trawl between Taunton and Bristol are endangering lives."It's vital to keep this facility open 24 hours 7 days a week."
Another said..
"Please sign.. we need our local services. Bristol and Taunton are too far away, for the person having to care for them, for the ambulance service having to trawl back and forth and waiting times for ambulance services are endangering lives."

attributes.action: Remove VAT on silver and platinum coins issued as legal tender.
attributes.background: The Royal Mint issues bullion and collectable coins in gold, silver and platinum. Gold is exempt from VAT but silver and platinum are not. There is no good reason for charging a value added sales tax on money at all. It is also inconsistent to have gold exempt.

attributes.action: Make banks reduce affordability criteria for mortgages for first time buyers.
attributes.background:
Affordability criteria with banks is currently around 3-4 times salary with adjustments for expenses. 

Even with Help-to-Buy, a person on the current living wage would have a £30,000 deficit on the 75% mortgage they would need to afford a £150,000 property.
attributes.additional_details:
The current affordability criteria makes it impossible for a single person to afford their own home. 

Banks are still making large profits, yet they seem unwilling to increase their risk in order help hardworking people afford their own place to live. 

Using mortgage calculators for a required amount, buyers see amounts which they feel they could afford, yet the affordability criteria excludes them from applying. 

This petition proposes banks meet the 75% regardless of salary for Help-to-Buy.

attributes.action: Offer tests for women on the NHS after ONE miscarriage
attributes.background: I have suffered 5 miscarriages in total, one being this year in 2017. I knew after the first two that something wasn’t right and pushed and pushed for testing. Unfortunately the NHS guidelines currently say that women need to have had 3 consecutive miscarriages before being offered tests.
attributes.additional_details: Now after 5 miscarriages I have been tested and found to have (aps) often known as sticky blood which means I would need a blood thinning injection daily if I was to become pregnant again. This could have saved my 5 babies’ lives but because of this guidance, that unfortunately wasn’t the case. I am hoping to get this changed so other women like myself can get the answers and save the heartbreak please help.

attributes.action: More funding towards cure research for Type 1 Diabetes
attributes.background: In June 2017 at the age of 18, I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. Beforehand I was perfectly healthy. I did nothing to cause this to come on, nor does anyone else suffering from this unfair disease.
attributes.additional_details: I'm requesting far more funding to go towards finding a cure for Type 1 Diabetes so that people who suffer from this unfair disease can have some hope.

attributes.action: Protect civilian war graves from the World wars
attributes.background: Having recently discovered that some civlian war graves are being overfilled for re-use,  I believe these should be rewarded due respect as are Military graves.
attributes.additional_details: Graves have already been overfilled at New Southgate and City of London cemetery (see https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/may/06/re-using-graves-means-uk-cemetery-will-never-run-out-of-space), are currently been threatened at Camberwell Cemetery and shortly so at Manor park cemetery

attributes.action: Ban cyclists from riding two abreast.
attributes.background: Driving through the Yorkshire Dales is quite a frustrating experience - driving behind 20 cyclists for miles with about 50 cars trying to pass. Impossible.

attributes.action: Air travellers: punish drunken and/or violent and/or threatening behaviour.
attributes.background: To apply within the confines of an airport, or on board an aircraft (especially where this threatens the safety of the aircraft, crew or passengers).  A mandatory 2-year ban from flying with any airline operating flights from the U.K., 5 years for a second offence, a life ban for any third offence.
attributes.additional_details: People arrested for drunkenness on planes has doubled in the last year.

attributes.action: Ban the use of ethylene glycol in antifreeze
attributes.background: As winter approaches, many of us put antifreeze in our engines for obvious reasons. I would like ethylene glycol to become a banned ingredient of antifreeze.

attributes.action: Make a law to stop people parking cars on communal lawns and grass verges.
attributes.background: When cars are parked on communal lawn areas in housing estates it causes the lawn to become messy with tyre ruts and it also makes the area look unsightly.This causes the ground to become uneven causing a trip hazard to the public. It also blocks the view of other drivers on the road.

attributes.action: Scrap credit card age verification on pornographic sites
attributes.background: The approach to the UK Digital Economy Act Section 3 on Online Pornography which requires every pornographic site to have age verification by holding credit card information of users is completely misguided and shows ministers have a complete lack of understanding of how the internet works.
attributes.additional_details: This will lead to porn companies storing vast amounts of credit card information which could easily be subject to hacking. Porn sites wont necessarily have the proper security. VPN, Tor Browser, proxy search or a torrent make age verification pointless with easy work arounds. Tor Browsers could lead to young people accessing content that is banned/illegal in the UK such as rape & child pornography videos on the dark web. Fraudulent porn sites could also potentially steal credit card information.

attributes.action: Any NEWSPAPER to be bound like BBC: to be fair, balanced, truthful and accurate.
attributes.background: At top of cover page, all publications to declare themselves to be a Newspaper, or Propaganda Sheet, Party Political publication, Advertising material, Lifestyle magazine, Specific Interest Publication. We need to know what we buy, just as we differentiate between reportage and advertisement.
attributes.additional_details:
The reason for this need is the existence of daily publications which:
•	deliberately distort their reporting by selection of facts, 
•	selectively headline items with a disproportionate emphasis on some topics, 
•	repeat items as if they were new or current when they are not, 
•	use biased, inflammatory or pejorative language, 
•	set a tone which encourages divisiveness and prejudice against particular groups or beliefs.
This is a serious and growing problem, today and in recent years.

attributes.action: Strip arriva rail north of the franchise as they are not giving customers 100%
attributes.background: We want to the government to strip arriva rail north of the franchise as the company are failing everywhere - trains delayed, they're getting rid of guards. As a company they are awful they don’t care about the customer they care about profits. Let’s get TransPennine operating the northern lines

attributes.action: Charge all Foreign Vehicles entering the UK
attributes.background: All Foreign Vehicles entering the UK to use our roads and motorways, to be charged a one year payment, and be issued a Vignette to register for their use of our road system.
attributes.additional_details:
If most of Europe can charge for their roads, it should be done in the UK, to help our economy, by extra revenue for maintaining our road infrastructure.
As an Island Nation we have the ideal opportunity, to charge at all Ports of entry.

attributes.action: Prevent the MOD from cutting Operational Allowance for our Armed Forces
attributes.background: Operational Allowance has compensated our Armed Forces for the additional dangers of serving in countries like Afghanistan and Iraq. The MOD is considering cutting this allowance. This will have a huge impact upon morale of those deploying or about to deploy and their families, and must be stopped.

attributes.action: Stop charging married women to have their surname changed on their passport
attributes.background: When people get married and wish to take their partners surname the UK government charges to have their surname changed. This discriminates against marriage and women in particular as it is normally this sex which takes the surname of their partner. The charge should be eliminated or greatly reduced

attributes.action: Nationalise the national lottery run by Camelot.
attributes.background:
All profits should go to NHS and schools etc.
It is a licence to print money so why  should a foreign company profit from a state run franchise.
attributes.additional_details: why shouldn't all profits go to bus or schools.

attributes.action: Make all advertisers state if their images have been doctored.
attributes.background: Both France and Israel have made it law that advertisers must put on their packaging that their images have been doctored. This is to stop the presentation of false body image. Britain should follow in their example.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, there have been instances where celebrities such as Kate Winlslet have made it public that images of them have been doctored. It should not be up to the models and celebrities to state this. There are countless doctored images that the public aren't aware about, that are constantly thrown in our faces. Advertisers should clearly state that their images have been doctored, as this can give some people the need to get the perfect body, which is obviously made up by some advertisers.

attributes.action: Working week to be split 40/60, weekend (Fri-Sun) weekday (Mon-Thurs)
attributes.background: I believe this should be considered with great thought as I think we over work ourseleves during the week and dont get enough breathing space to enjoy our own time and time with our familes, overworking can lead to mental and physical health issues so I believe this can help fix that.
